metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7346 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The vmw_gb_surface_define_ioctl function in drivers/gpu/drm/vmwgfx/vmwgfx_surface.c in the Linux kernel through 4.10.7 does not validate certain levels data, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (system hang) via a crafted ioctl call for a /dev/dri/renderD* device. Li Qiang discovered that the DRM driver for VMware Virtual GPUs in the Linux kernel did not properly validate some ioctl arguments. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7346` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-125-generic - 3.13.0-125.174
